topic.title: RBAC User Management
topic.shortdesc: Couchbase RBAC allows defined users to be assigned roles, which permit access to resources.

section.title: Specifying Names
section.p: Both role-names and user-names are case sensitive.

section.title: Authentication Domains
section.p: Couchbase Server assigns users to different authentication domains, based on whether their definition is local (that is, on Couchbase Server itself) or external (that is, by means of LDAP or PAM).

section.title: Creating Users
section.p: Users can be created in the following ways:

ul.li: With the Couchbase Web Console: See Creating and Managing Users with the UI.
By means of the Couchbase CLI command user-manage.

section.p: For restrictions on username-design, see Couchbase Passwords.

section.title: Resetting a User Password
section.p: A user's password can be set in the following ways:

ul.li: With the Couchbase Web Console. See Creating and Managing Users with the UI.
By means of the Couchbase CLI command user-manage.

section.p: Note that a default Couchbase password policy is provided: this can be modified by the Full Administrator. See the Couchbase CLI command setting-password-policy.
For best practices for password-definition, see Couchbase Passwords.

section.title: Viewing Users
section.p: Currently defined users can be viewed in the following ways:

ul.li: With the Couchbase Web Console. See Creating and Managing Users with the UI.

section.title: Granting and Revoking Roles
section.p: Roles can be granted and revoked as follows:

ul.li: Granted: With the N1QL GRANT ROLE statement. See GRANT.
Revoked: With the N1QL REVOKE ROLE statement. See REVOKE.
